intro: Blepharis caloneura, commonly known as the narrow-leaved blepharis, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its slender, erect stem and narrow, lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, tubular flowers that are typically pale blue or purple in color. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in rocky or sandy habitats. Blepharis caloneura is adapted to arid environments and is known for its ability to survive in dry conditions.
